page.title: 14DRY STONE WALLS.
page.content: The whole of our area is criss-crossed with walls. They form intricate patterns across the countryside, casting velvety lines of shadow. They have to be built to withstand the very harsh wintry weather of the region. They then form a protection for the crops against strong winds and drifting snow. The walls in our area are made of a variety of types of stone. The shape of the wall depends upon the stone used. There are many animals that live in the walls, like spiders, mice and insects. Even birds nest there because the walls shelter them from the wind and rain. The walls are maintained by the farmers or by young people on conservation projects.
